revised_title: The Discovery of Secretin and Its Role in Pancreatic Secretion
tldr: Bayliss and Starling discover that the secretion of pancreatic juice is not a local reflex but is caused by a substance produced in the intestinal mucous membrane under the influence of acid, which they term'secretin.' This finding marks a significant advancement in understanding the chemical functions of the body and the mechanisms of the gastrointestinal system.
